text: How are you using MarketMuse in your content creation workflow? Bought their AppSumo deal that provides access to Research, Compete, Optimize, Questions, and Connect (as well as some limited use of Briefs), and looking forward to testing more.

elements.text: How are you using MarketMuse in your content creation workflow? Bought their AppSumo deal that provides access to Research, Compete, Optimize, Questions, and Connect (as well as some limited use of Briefs), and looking forward to testing more.

text:
I'm using the same limited account when updating older articles. Once identified what will be updated, I'm running each keyword through Questions, Research and Compete (leaving Optimize and Connect for a later stage), export every report onto a spreadsheet and share with content writers.

Since briefs are paid (and quite expensive for our price range/budget), Im combining MarketMuse insights with Topic reports. I feel MarketMuse questions are superior, and there are some really good suggestions on the keywords. But I use Topic to create my outlines faster. Frankly, MarketMuse can be combined with any other on-page tool to increase the quality of your briefs.

I haven't yet shared the account with a freelancer (though it being a lifetime one, I have no worries doing so), and I use Topic's own Optimize version only, as their reports are shareable and editable, rather than having only a log-in access.

text: Makes sense, thanks Kal. That's what I've been doing so far, combining it with Ahrefs for initial kw research + Frase for faster topic outlining.

text:
Just discovered Google Search Consoles Data Highlighter. Anyone know how effective this tool is for schema mark up? Is there a better one?

(Schema is a part of my skillset I’m working to upgrade.)
